Description: Gulls come in a variety of types and sizes, with this particular species native to the land of Northern Elysium. With wingspans that reach up to 1 meter in length, the Larus Elysionus establishes its domain in the skies of Elysium’s coastal shores. It eats fish alongside rodents and reptiles. Fruits, seeds, and eggs make up these omnivorous birds’ diet as well. The photographed specimen above appears to have a blue belt around its neck, a sign of rescue from a certain beloved hero of Elysium.
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A white Seagull in flight. The tips of its wings and tail feathers are black. It has a bright blue belt around its neck.

Description: While they look like jellyfish, Portuguese Man O' Wars are actually siphonophores. They are made up of individual organisms that work together to operate as one entity. This creature is named after an old warship at full sail. They have a balloon-like float that they use to travel by being propelled by wind for thousands of miles. Hidden beneath the float are long strands of tentacles packed with enough venom to kill small fish. Despite the danger, certain fishes have been found living within them.
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A purple and blue Portuguese Man o’ War. Its body is shaped like a teapot spout, with jellyfish-like tentacles attached to the bottom. Its top fin is light purple and translucent.

Description: Whale, whale, whale, look who decided to show up. It’s the largest mammal on Earth, the blue whale! Despite their massive size, they’re quite the gentle giant posing no threat to humans by feeding on plankton through baleen in their mouths. They often communicate through clicks, whistles, and pulsed calls. Perhaps if you listen close enough, you’ll be able to hear the faint melody of “On Top of the World.” Fun Fact: Did you know their ancestors used to walk the Earth nearly 50 million years ago?
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A Blue Whale, facing left. Its back is a dark blue color, and its belly is white. It has translucent, light blue fins, and floating crystals near its eyes of the same color.

Description: They don’t call this the “killer” whale for nothing. Among the largest of ocean mammals, the Killer Whale is known to be a fast swimmer who takes long walks at 3 AM in search of its meal. With 46 sharp teeth perfect for tearing, the Killer Whale is especially volatile when alone. Once its prey catches sight of its red light fragments, it’s already too late…
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A Killer Whale, facing left. Its body is mostly black, with a white belly and white spot above its eye. It has red crystals floating near its face.

Description: Nicknamed the giant jellyfish, this not-fish is far from being a short king. With the largest one recorded to have a stunning mane of tentacles measuring up to 120 ft, its length rivals the blue whale! Whether you jelly-ve it or not, it’s true. Sadly, it isn’t the record holder for the longest marine creature out there, but that's a story for another day. You go, not-short king!
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A Lion’s Mane Jellyfish, swimming diagonally. It has a translucent, white, umbrella-shaped top, with bright red tentacles trailing behind it.

Description: Take a good look at the Loggerhead Sea Turtle. Any guess why it’s named like that? Yes, it’s named after its adorable log-like head! Take another good look at it. See that adorable but powerful jaw? They use it to crack shells open, be it crabs, clams, or conches, with a nice, good CRONCH! Take one more good look. Look at its adorable eyes peering into your soul. Don't you just want to love and protect it with your life? Or with Leader’s shiny light armor? Well, we really should; it’s endangered!
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A brown and tan coloured Loggerhead Sea Turtle. Along its brown shell as well as the base of its fins, it has blue, glowing armor, reminiscent of Altare's.

Description: Hanging out by the Northern Elysium Bay, the manta ray is seen feeding on plankton, krill, larvae, small fish, and others. With a wingspan of about 12ft, a certain manta ray has the ability to swim up to 30 mph as it is slightly smaller than the average manta ray. This manta ray has a unique pattern that resembles the night sky and can be seen leaping about 3ft out of the water during a full moon. Because this manta ray has a night sky pattern, they enjoy hiding behind rocks and tall plants to spook night-time creatures that pass by, such as squid and schools of fish.
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A dark blue-gray Manta Ray. The underside of its fins, body, and tail are all a lighter blue. The top side of its body has light blue and white spots.

Description: Mola Mola are known to be among the stranger-looking fish as they look more like flattened fish heads with large dorsal and ventral fins. They spend most of their lives drifting with water currents and wandering from one ocean to another with little care. Often found in warmer waters, many people have seen this giant fish flipped on its side and basking in the sun to regulate its temperature. This is how they have gotten their nickname, the “Sunfish.”
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A round, gray Mola Mola. It's mostly white, with a dark gray, dotted gradient towards its outer fins. It has a similarly gray pectoral fin.

Description: As the name goes swimmingly, the Oceanic Whitetip is a fa-sea-nating requiem shark that can be found in warmer waters of the open ocean. Being opportunistic feeders, they feed on almost anything they come across. Like other requiem sharks, they are sand-sationally nonstop swimmers who rely on ram breathing, actively hunting during day and night. They are notoriously gill-ty for being past shipwreck victim feeders with jaws-ome group hunting skills. You can swim, but you can't tide!
Fish Image Alt Text Description: An Oceanic Whitetip Shark. The majority of its body is a dark blue, with the tips of its fins and belly being white. It has green eyes with cat-slit pupils.

Description: While hatching at only a few millimeters long and weighing a few hundredths of a gram, swordfish evolve from being preyed upon at birth to becoming one of the largest and most aggressive predators prowling the open ocean. They hold specialized blood vessel structures, known as countercurrent exchangers, that warm their brains and eyes, enabling them to think quicker and see more clearly while hunting in deep waters. And yes, they are capable of impaling humans, so please avoid provoking one.
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A Swordfish. It has a long, navy blue body with round, fluorescent, cyan designs all across it. It’s wearing gray, metal armor around its torso and bottom jaw, with a hook attached near its tail fin.

Description: They are one of the largest fish in the ocean, but don’t let the size intimidate you, as whale sharks are one of the most docile sharks out there. Whale sharks have light armor, and the spotted pattern in their body resembles a starry sky with the exception of their belly, which is white. The size of their teeth is very small, so instead of chewing their food, they use a filter function by suctioning the water to catch their prey, which are normally plankton, krill, and algae.
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A large Whale Shark. It has a white underside, while its top side is indigo with a cosmic, starry pattern.

Description: A fish once thought to be extinct but recently rediscovered to still be alive. Coelacanth are medium-sized fish and usually live at the bottom of the ocean. Some believed that they may be ancestors of tetrapods, though this was recently questioned. A lesser-known fact about coelacanths is that they are excellent at helping people’s self-esteem with the phrase “Don’t be coelaCAN’T, be coelaCAN!” They are also unable to drive most cars.
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A blue Coelacanth, swimming left. The fish has lighter blue spots across its body, with a medium blue base. 3 of its 5 visible fins are also this lighter blue.

Description: Everyone's favorite well-armed tenta-cool friend. Ink-redible chromatophoric creatures with no bad bone in their body (literally as they're boneless), the octopus is clever, curious, and cheeky with commendable competency for camouflaging conjointly with corals. Blue-blooded, three-hearted, and nine-brained, this particular octopus is considered a cosmopolitan species. It can be found almost anywhere in the world!
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A light mint green and bright orange Octopus, looking right. It has an orange face, with the undersides and tips of its outstretched tentacles being a similar color.

Description: An angel of a fish, the angelfish roams the midwater zone of the ocean! This one in particular has its appearance inspired by the leader of Guild Tempus who runs his guild swimmingly. These little guys can come in almost every color of the rainbow! Angelfish will eat anything that looks good, even the slightest but tasty! Like Guild Tempus, angelfish can have their own leaders - in which there are subspecies that are referred to as Queens or Kings! They can be spotted by their distinct blue-ringed black spot on top of their heads with a speckled pattern.
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A light blue and purple striped Angelfish. It has pointy, translucent, light blue fins with turquoise and pink detailing at the tips.

Description: When at rest, blue sea slugs float without abandon away from their coastal homes for hours, their bodies absorbing the sun’s rays. However, sailors warn not to earn their ire. They’re nicknamed sea dragons for a reason. They’ve been known to aid lost ships–for a price. You can refuse their help; they won’t be insulted. Accept, and they’ll use their bioluminescent bodies to lead the way to land. Just don’t forget to pay them, or they’ll take your life as payment the next time you enter the water.
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A blue, monochromatic sea slug. It has stripes all across its body, including on the six star-shaped appendages attached to its sides.

Description: If this fish could talk, it’d tell you to “Keep your friends close, but your anemones closer.” One of the most iconic fish in the underwater world, they are easily characterized by their striped pattern. Clownfish have a mutualistic partnership with anemones; anemones offer protection and a place to lay their eggs, and clownfish provide the anemone with food. Because of this partnership, clownfish have evolved to have a mucus coating that makes them immune to the anemone’s defensive sting.
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A smiling, medium blue Clownfish. It has thick, light blue stripes across its body. Near its face, there is a mint green crystal, mimicking Altare’s armor.

Description: Flying fish are a family of fish known for their ability to leap out of the water and glide through the air because of their wing-like fins. Flying fish leap out of the water to escape their undersea predators, but this doesn’t keep them safe from birds catching them. They are found in every ocean, but especially in tropical areas. They have also been known to leap onto boats.
Fish Image Alt Text Description: An indigo and white Flying Fish. It has green eyes and translucent, light blue fins. Near its face it has a light blue design reminiscent of Altare’s armor.

Description: Located off the coast of Northern Elysium, the leafy seadragon makes its home in shallow reefs, where its leaflike appendages serve as effective camouflage among the kelp and seagrasses. Instead of scales, this creature’s body is covered with jointed, armor-like plates to help protect it from predators. Although it may appear tough and bony underneath its foliage, the leafy seadragon swims with a slow grace, befitting the mythical creature it is named after.
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A Leafy Seadragon with a thin, gray-brown body. It has a long nose, and blue, leaf-like appendages sprouting from its body.

Description: If you ever see a shining, bioluminescent jelly near a shallow bay during a full moon, chances are that it is a blue moon jelly. The resilient resident of the sea’s glow serves two purposes: a.) to attract a potential mate and b.) to warn predators. Consequently, it thrives even in inhabitable waters and has an azure dome due to its main diet consisting of aquamarine slimes.  The blue moon jelly tends to be a loner, but when it joins its jelly friends, they are collectively called a bloom.
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A translucent, white Moon Jellyfish. It has frilly tentacles, and an umbrella-shaped body. Around its top there is a blue, luminescent design reminiscent of Altare’s armor.

Description: The name “nudibranch” refers to about 3000 known species of undersea mollusks, but they are more commonly known as sea slugs. Because they have no shells, sea slugs have other defense mechanisms to survive, so they come in many different shapes, colors, and textures to blend into their surroundings. They often live in coral reefs, so their colors are often bright to match. Sea slugs are found in oceans all around the world.
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A blue Nudibranch/Sea Slug. It has light blue polka dots on its body, and frilly appendages attached to its back and sides. It wears a dark blue belt around its neck.

Description: A lot of people consider them as shells, but they are more similar to urchins. A known characteristic of the sand dollar is that it has a pattern resembling a flower on both of its sides, but the specimen living in this aquarium emits a gentle blue glow through theirs. They might look fuzzy, but since they are a type of urchin, the sand dollars must be handled with care, even if they are not poisonous, as they have long spines. One could say it is the current-sea of the ocean!
Fish Image Alt Text Description: An orange and brown spotted Sand Dollar. It's round, with a light blue flower-like design in the center.

Description: Beguiling you with its adorable ears, the sea bunny is not an ordinary citizen of the sea. Its fluffy fur has various functions, such as acting as its sensory organs. For its main diet, it preys on sea sponges, algae, and seagrass. Thus, it mostly makes a home in tropical waters. Sounds harmless, right? Not really. Under threat, the sea bunnytare has the ability to steal the toxins of its prey and the stinging cells from the jellyfish in order to build its defense mechanism.
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A blue Sea Bunny. It has long, dark blue ears, and a dark blue tail. Near its face, there are light blue shards, evocative of Altare’s armor.

Description: The sea cucumber is located within the deep seafloor in Elysium. He has a snazzy belt that all the other sea cucumbers are jealous of and glowing blue armor that helps him with predators. This little guy mostly goes with the flow unless you pick on him, then he will get so upset that he’ll have to spew out his sticky insides in defense, but his insides grow back. He usually uses his tiny tube feet to eat and shuffle along the seafloor.
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A light blue Sea Cucumber. It’s wearing a dark blue belt, and has short, diamond shaped spines along its back, with floating, blue armor shards near its face. There are white tentacles coming from its mouth.

Description: The tiny seahorse may look harmless, but it’s a skilled ambush predator, using its elongated snout to inhale and consume its prey. It is rumored that a certain variant is more agile than normal and possesses luminescent plates along its body that resemble armor. This creature is also notable for its high dexterity stat; it uses its flexible tail to grasp objects, anchoring it to vegetation and helping it to navigate. Mated pairs will even be seen swimming together with tails linked.
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A bright red Seahorse. Along its stomach and face, it has blue, glowing armor, akin to the set Altare wears.

Description: These ray-finned fish craft homes by burrowing into the seafloor with pointy tails, expelling sand as they go by wiggling their dorsal fin. Once complete, they secrete slime to cement the walls. When feeding on plankton, up to 2/3 of their body may be exposed, and they can escape predators by retreating into the burrow tail first. Despite their minuscule size, spotted garden eels can have lengthy life spans of up to 40 years, so be careful if you ever insult one. You may be insulting your elder.
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A group of blue Spotted Garden Eels, arising from a pile of sand, and looking left. They vary in color, from light blue to turquoise, with leopard-like spots.

Description: A member of the mackerel family, this fish is often found schooling with tuna. They can travel down to depths of 165 meters (or 550 feet) in search of food. They are carnivorous, feeding on clupeoides, crustaceans, fish, and squid. Unfortunately, the striped bonito has been poorly studied by scientists, and more detailed information about this species is unknown.
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A Striped Bonito, coloured with various shades of gray. It has a small, white star pattern near its pectoral fin, as well as near its tail.

Description: This particular tang species consumes a special kind of algae that potion makers and alchemists need for their concoctions. How it’s used or harvested from the tangs is unknown. Also, ship cooks will keep a few as pets while out at sea. Those that do always have a refreshing drink ready for the crew. Just don’t ask what the cook is doing, bringing his fish for a walk from his quarters every morning, and don’t peek in the special barrels kept in the galleys; you’ll be in for a tang-y surprise…
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A pale blue Tang. It has stripes that gradient from light to dark blue across its flat body. Next to the dark blue spot underneath its eye, there is a cyan crystal. Its indigo fins have thin white stripes.

Description: This strange-looking animal is a member of class Hydrozoa, which includes the Portuguese Man O’ War, siphonophores, and some jellyfish. Each one is a colony of hydroid polyps living in its turquoise mantle. The most distinctive feature of this animal is the transparent sail atop its body, used to travel the oceans via wind. Like other Hydrozoans, it is carnivorous and feeds on plankton. While effective on prey, its tentacle sting is mostly harmless to humans, causing only redness and itching.
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A Velella velella. It has a flat, dinner plate-like body with a white, translucent center surrounded by a dark blue outer ring, with similarly blue tentacles underneath. Along its topside, it has a transparent sailfin.

Description: This mysterious creature has only rarely been sighted, being seen about 100 times since its discovery, so not much about it is known for certain. It’s believed to use its long, flowing arms to capture prey and draw it up to its mouth, the prey most likely being plankton and small fish. This ghostly jelly is believed to live in every ocean worldwide except the Arctic Ocean.
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A Giant Phantom Jellyfish. It has a beige, mushroom-cap-shaped body, with a red center. Attached to its body are long, thick, beige tentacles.

Description: There are numerous sea creatures with unfathomable power that have lived for centuries, and the Luminousa is one of them. When its life is about to end, it transfers part of its life onto a new body, which can be found in the glowing crystal at the top. Through this ability, the fish has become wiser at detecting its predators and avoiding them. This also includes humans. However, the creature acted docile and seemed curious about the blue-haired hero visiting the aquarium.
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A large Luminousa. This fantasy fish has a scaly, pale blue body with a yellow, shield-like design on its pectoral fin. The tip of said fin is yellow. It has yellow crystals on its head, back, and tail fins.

Description: The Vineya Milethry is a durable creature found in the deeper parts of Elysium's seas. It uses counterillumination and takes advantage of its transparent body to camouflage and blend in with its surroundings, avoiding predators while catching prey off guard. Other creatures familiar with it can take advantage of its physiology to evade predators pursuing them, tricking them into the Siphonophore to entangle them with its tentacles and have them stung and paralyzed by the nematocysts within.
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A tiny purple, jellyfish-like creature that has a long, ribbon-like purple tail with almost invisible purple streamers hanging from it.

Description: Ever wonder which creature has the biggest brain? Look no further than the sperm whale (which Altventurers like to call "beeg brain whaletare!"), who lives in communities called "pods." It's said that its ancestor befriended a local Elysian hero who, as a symbol of friendship, taught the creature how to sing, which is now passed on each generation. This is now known as echolocation and vocalization. This sea mammal also uses a series of clicks called "codas'' as another communication form.
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A large Sperm Whale. Its body gradients from a cyan topside to a darker blue belly. Around its body, there are floating bright blue shards.

Description: Similar to other deep-sea fish such as the dragonfish, one of the most notable features of the anglerfish is the rod-like appendage containing a sac of bioluminescent bacteria. Drawn in by the glow it produces, prey is lured to its unassuming death, skewered and ripped apart by the dozens of teeth decorating this fish’s jaws. However, this appendage adorns only female anglerfish, as males are much tinier in comparison and survive only by attaching themselves to mates and feeding off them.
Fish Image Alt Text Description: An Anglerfish. Its body has a pastel to medium blue gradient, with a hexagonal pattern throughout. On its head, there is a bright blue, lamp-like appendage.

Description: The elusive creature is a rare sight in all of the world’s deep-sea environments. With its long-thin body and evolved dim-light photoreceptors in its eyes, it’s adopted a sit-and-wait predation. It lures small fish and invertebrates by emitting its glowing scales on its tail end as they flash from pink to red. When its prey is close enough, it uses its umbrella-like mouth to vacuum and swallow its prey whole. Humans are not on its list of prey.
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A dark indigo Gulper Eel. It has bright blue and yellow fins running along its long, thin body. Near its pink, open mouth, it has blue, translucent armor, similar to Altare's.

Description: The slaphappy jellyfalse is an Elysian coastal fish. Its tail, which resembles a jellyfish, allows it to stealthily hunt prey and ward off predators of fish. The tail is not merely an imitation: its tendrils contain a numbing toxin that it uses on its prey. However, it is still vulnerable, as the toxin is useless against predators of jellyfish. The tail tastes like fruit, so it is often made into drinks or desserts and served alongside the fish portion, which is grilled with spices.
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A bright yellow Slaphappy Jellyfalse. This fantasy creature has a dome-shaped jellyfish body, with attached tentacles that hide a striped, mustard coloured fish with sharp teeth.

Description: Despite the name, the dogfish are sharks! They have a distinctive tooth structure, as their teeth look similar to fangs with wide gaps in between. One of the unique dogfish’s features is missing a specific muscle that would help pull forward the jaw when they are going after prey. Instead, they have a hyomandibular bone. This bone swings down and forward to compensate for the muscle and ends up working even better for the dogfish as they can move their jaws vertically and horizontally.
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A black Viper Dogfish. It has black horns on its head and bright blue eyes. Inside its open mouth, its upper jaw bone is detached from its upper lip.

Description: Ghosting Arctic and Antarctic waters, the mysterious Chimaera can be found swimming across all other oceans. This spectral deep ocean dweller is also known as the ghost shark despite not actually being a shark. The ghost in their name stems from the way they propel themselves in the water with wing-like pectoral fins. They do have a cuter name, though—rabbit fish. Maybe Buntare would know more about this cartilaginous enigmatic deep-sea fellow…?
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A silver Chimaera. It has a thin, bright blue stripe running across its body. The tips of its fins are a similar, fluorescent blue color. Near its eye, it has blue, crystalline shards.

Description: Grenadiers are a subfamily of fish that have large heads and eyes with thinner bodies and tails, giving them the nickname “rattails.” Because of the deep, dark water they live in, their eyes are this large to help them see their bioluminescent prey. Some species have their own bioluminescent lights on their bodies. Many species are thought to live over fifty years. Grenadiers are commonly served as seafood.
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A bright cyan Grenadier Fish. The tips of its fins are indigo, with similarly coloured designs near its face, and part-way down its long, thin body.

Description: Deep in the heart of the Elysian Ocean lives one of the shyest altventurer slimes: the dumbo octopus named the slimebo. Denizens say it used to be a land slime that yearned to swim. Thus, after hundreds of years, its tentacles evolved to be connected by a web of skin resembling an umbrella, and it developed a membrane that protects its body from dissolving in the water. Another folklore cited its distinct belt to be similar to that of a local Elysian hero, using this body part to find its kind.
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A Deep-Sea Dumbo Octopus. Its body is mostly white, with its floppy, ear-like fins and tentacles having a red gradient. It has a blue belt tied around its body.

Description: True to its name, the fangtooth fish sports an intimidating pair of chompers. Despite their intimidating predatory appearance, fangtooth fish are no real threat to humans due to their size. Instead, they prey on a variety of small fish and squid. Now, if you had to make a bet on who the vampire lord of the sea was, who would you bet on? The fangtooth fish or the vampire squid? Fun fact: in order for fangtooth fish to close their mouths, they’ve evolved to have special pouches.
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A blue and green Fangtooth Fish. It has a triangular pattern on its face, and sharp white teeth. Along its tear-shaped body, there is a luminescent, cyan stripe. Its fins gradient from turquoise  to translucent.

Description: One of the smallest sharks that live in the depths of the sea in Elysium. Their upper teeth are sharp and triangular, while their lower teeth are chunks of flesh, which allow them to easily scoop pests attacking marine sustainability. Because they live in the depths of the sea, their green-white eyes are able to light up through the dark sea. Even though they have sharp teeth, they are not dangerous because they tend to be shy and prefer to help protect the sea of Elysium from monsters.
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A blue Cookiecutter shark. Towards the tips of its pectoral and tail fins, it goes from bright blue to a darker periwinkle. It has downturned eyebrows and an open, frowning mouth.

Description: A denizen of near sunless waters, this jellyfish can’t be seen without the aid of light. Once illuminated, it looks like a firework frozen in time, its very poisonous and thin tendrils glowing brilliantly away from its body. Sightings of this jellyfish are very rare for one big reason: when it feels threatened, it releases a charge that can break the sound barrier and sends out a concussive wave that can be felt even on the surface. Caution is highly suggested if more than one is encountered.
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A Halitrephes, or Firework Jellyfish. It has a bright blue, dome shaped body, with tentacles that gradient from pink, to maroon, to cherry red.

Description: A fish with a hatchet-shaped body, which they use to jump out of the water to catch small insects. There are at least two types of hatchet fish, such as freshwater and marine. If you want to know more, I recommend you "axe" a marine biologist. Also, like most fish, they are unable to drive cars or operate heavy machinery.
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A Hatchetfish. Its body and pectoral fins are pastel blue, with leaf green dorsal, underside, and tail fins.

Description: The flashlight fish may be small, but it is fierce and beautiful. Its unique bioluminescent markings make up an armor-like defense against other less-friendly fish, confusing them by “turning the lights out” and becoming invisible in the sea gloom. The flashlight fish is nocturnal, conducting most of its activities in the dark of night (like a totally-normal 3 am walk!). Its light is useful in guiding its kin through the darkest caves, like a little hero!
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A Flashlight fish. It has a medium blue body, with a darker blue face. Under its eye it has a light blue spot, with similar spots in a line across its body. Its striped fins gradient from light to dark blue.

Description: The size and weight of these fish vary with species, yet the smallest are born with no teeth or stomach, preventing them from eating and, by extension, living long lives. One of the dragonfish's most unique features is its chlorophyll-filled eyes, which no other creature is known to hold. Another notable trait is the luminescent lure hanging from its chin, used to entice prey. Considering how often we're told to go toward the light, it's a good thing we're too large for them to eat…
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A small, black Dragonfish. It has white whiskers. Its fins have a red to blue gradient, with a blue design near its tail fin that is reminiscent of Altare's armor.

Description: The Eelpout are a species of fish that reside deep in the ocean and are known for their speed. Researchers do not have much information about them, but they possess a unique glow-in-the-dark pattern similar to that of a certain guild leader. They can turn this pattern off to hide themselves from predators and ambush other species as a pack. The Eelpout have also been observed to lay eggs and protect their offspring. Despite their name and appearance, they are NOT related to eels at all.
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A brightly coloured Eelpout. The top of its long body is a medium blue, with a purple underside. Its fins and eyes are orange. Near its middle, there is a cyan design, evocative of Altare's armor.

Description: One of the deepest fish that loves to be in and around coral reefs. They have beautiful scales that light up and magical powers such as, when moving, their body leaves beautiful crystal dust. The lucent fisk really love to hang out around the coral reef because it's easy to find their favorite food, rocks!
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A bright blue fish made of building blocks, what look to be blue-tinged clear pieces are made to look like they’re floating around its fins.

Description: Deep-sea jellyfish are a beauty to behold, making other fish quite jelly of how they flow through the ocean with their glow, but be careful as these majestic creatures are highly dangerous due to the venom released when they sting! Due to a shard of light armor entering the deep-sea waters, a curious jellyfish ate it, thinking it was another fish, but it gained its properties as the jelly glows a bright blue with a purple gradient on the tip of their tentacles.
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A swimming, Deep-Sea Jellyfish. It has a round body, with a white to blue gradient. It has similarly blue tentacles coming from its bottom. Where the tentacles connect, there are blue shards.

Description: Neither an octopus nor a squid, isn't actually bloodsucking, and comes with a pair of large round eyes, the marine snow-feeder vampire squid can be found scavenging the deep, oxygen-minimum zones of the ocean. These cloaked cephalopods appear to have bright blue eyes (actually clear), cannot change color to camouflage, and don't produce any ink for defense. Instead, they have a cool, light-emanating organ that gives them bioluminescence at the tips of their tentacles, like their own light armor!
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A bright pink Vampire Squid. It has two, floppy fins on the sides of its head. The webbing between its tentacles is a mint green, with its eyes being a similar color.

Description: Morphologically, the giant squid is quite similar to smaller squids, possessing the same features but on a much grander scale. The diameter of its eyes is one of the largest of all known living animals, falling just short of that of its relative, the colossal squid. It may not be false to call these beings “all-seeing” as the size of their eyes allows them to discern large shapes at distances of over 394 ft/120 m. All the better to see you with, indeed…
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A pastel blue giant squid. Pale blue shards float around the conical end of the creature. The tentacles start at the body as a darker pastel blue and then pale to almost white at the tips.

Description: Giant tubeworms typically live in massive colonies that thrive in hot, mineral-laden water. This environment is a product of the thermal vents that result from underwater volcanic activity. They’re one of the heaviest animals to thrive in this extreme condition. To protect themselves from predators, their feather-like gills are able to retract into their bodies through sulfur in a process not dissimilar to photosynthesis. Now, would you still love me if I was a giant tubeworm?
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A group of white, noodle-like grouping of creatures, each tipped with a deep red end. A couple of very thin, bright blue fish can be seen swimming among the white stalks.

Description: This very rare shark, named for the size of its mouth, is the smallest of the filter-feeding sharks, after the whale and basking sharks. The megamouth shark’s existence was a recent discovery in 1976, thanks to one accidentally becoming entangled in a naval research ship’s anchor northeast of Oahu, Hawai’i. However, its true home waters are unknown; this shark can turn up wherever, whenever when least expected. Needless to say, this makes them incredibly difficult for scientists to study.
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A dark gray shark with glowing blue shards floating around the entirety of its body. What appears to be a dark blue belt is wrapped around the top half of its tail.

Description: Not a fish.
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A black mass that seems to fuzz out of focus around the edges. Arms, tentacles and teeth come out at random intervals and an uncomfortable number of eyes are staring directly at the viewer. This is a creature that cannot exist.

Description: An ancient creature that has been protecting the Elysium seas for centuries, it lives in the deepest parts of the ocean and only ascends when there is a huge threat to the ocean. Parts of it seem to be mechanically powered, and it is able to generate energy constructs on its arms. However, the construction of this creature's body remains a mystery.
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A mostly white-blue creature that appears to be made out of large scales. Orange scales that give the appearance of a helmet, chest plate, vambraces, and a waist. Pale blue shields are at the end of each arm.

Description: A bunch of sea worms? No, no, these creatures aren't worms. A closer relation of theirs is jellyfish. Each Siphonophore consists of zooids, individual creatures attached together to form a colony. Living in the depths of Elysium waters, one would scarcely get the chance to come across these creatures as an adventurer. Yet, records show that a brave blue hero once ventured below and encountered a larger-than-usual B. conifera. Or as he called it: The Friendly Flying Spaghetti Monster.
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A jellyfish-like creature that has a yellow core which fades to a greenish-blue on the outer edge. Tentacles are a mixture of chunkier, red and orange protrusions and longer, almost invisible strings. A single string appears above the creature, ending in a small yellow dot.

Description: The viper dogfish, also called the viper shark, is a unique species of shark found in the Pacific Ocean near Japan, the Bonin Islands, and the Hawaiian Islands. They can swallow fish nearly whole by using their bone and muscle structure to extend their jaws to impale prey on their long teeth. They also have small, venomous spines on their dorsal fins. They often move between water levels, staying in deeper waters during the day and moving to higher waters at night.
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A black fish with white fins tipped in back. White stripes appear lengthwise along the body. The mouth is slightly agape with crooked, pin-like teeth and it has a light blue eye.

Description: The atolla jellyfish is a deep-sea dweller, residing in the ocean’s bathypelagic zone where sunlight does not reach. This jellyfish’s normally red body is camouflaged in these depths, but if threatened, it lights up in a display of bright blue bioluminescence. The flashes of light serve to disorient predators or even attract larger predators that can chase off the attacker. This strategy has given the species the nickname of “alarm jelly.”
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A chunky red-orange jellyfish who’s tentacles hang from its midsection. Above the tentacles is a translucent dome that shines blue on top and looks lit with an orange fire on the bottom.

Description: Named after the space traveler who once visited Elysium, the chambered nautilus (Star Keeper in Elysium) is a shy, deep ocean creature known for its effortless buoyancy and gilded coiled shell. Like its namesake, it gracefully glides across its territory using jet propulsion from its tentacles to navigate turns. Thus, if you see it while scuba-diving, observe its delicate movements. Let it eat its prey of fish, crabs, and lobsters. Wish it well as it protects itself in the wide underwater world.
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A creature resembling if a squid moved into a snail shell. The soft, squid-like portion is white with numerous tentacles floating, the shell is a dark blue striped with white in a tiger pattern. Light blue crystals float above.

Description: According to what people would most commonly think, single-celled organisms like Xenophyphores generally have microscopic sizes. Xenophyophores, of course, are macroscopic anyway because they don’t care what humans think is impossible. These deep sea creatures live primarily on the surface of the ocean floor and build elaborate houses and shells called tests (hopefully, this won’t appear in yours!). They form distinct patterns and can look like fans, brains, or even resemble the Hollow Tree!
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A tree-like coral whose trunk and branches are a bright, almost neon blue. The ‘leaves’ are a mix of light blue and purple.

Description: These amphipods were discovered in one of the deepest regions of the Peru-Chile Trench back in 2018. As a new species, there is still much to learn. While they are small compared to other creatures of the sea, they are twice the size of their nearest relative, making them a "giant." They come in a range of colors, such as white, pink, crimson, or dark red. They play a "scavenger" within the trench community, quickly intercepting and distributing any type of food sinking from above.
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A brown-colored crustacean-like creature that almost resembles a shrimp. It has a semi-translucent segmented body, multiple pairs of legs, and prominent antennae.

Description: The Crossota millsae, or Psychedelic Jellyfish, is a small, brightly coloured jellyfish that dwells in the depths of the ocean. These jellies are classified as plankton, meaning they typically spend the majority of their mostly solitary lives drifting through the ocean instead of actively swimming. Due to their relatively recent discovery and the inhospitable environment they make their home, not much else is known about this species.
Fish Image Alt Text Description: An orange jellyfish that’s got spiky tentacles coming out of the bottom of the body. The main body is translucent and seems to have a solid core that resembles a cat’s eye.

Description: Within the deepest ocean trench in Elysium lives an unassuming creature that looks similar to a tadpole. The Mariana Snailfish has a protruding stomach and skin so clear you can see its internal organs. It belongs to the snailfish species and may be a distant cousin to Snailtare. Like its cousin, the snailfish continue to push boundaries! Unidentified snailfish species were filmed on camera as deep as 8,336 m. (27,349 ft.) and currently hold the record for Elysium’s deepest fish caught in 4k!
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A long, slender light blue fish with a single fin that begins just behind the head and then wraps around its body much like an eel. Two more normal fins are on the lower portion of the body and a small, pale blue crystal floats near its beady black eye.

Description: This mutated form of Magmite has become highly adapted to life in the ocean, living peacefully on the seafloor. They enjoy consuming scraps and dead organisms that find their way down there. These Magmites have an excellent sense of smell and can even swim up if they choose to. Though, unlike their original form, these Magmites have developed a toxicity that makes them inedible.
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A purple magmite with a red underside, golden lines run down its chubby purple limbs. Two small, purple tentacle-like protrusions tipped in red grow out of its backside, while long, back-sweeping antennae can be seen just behind the eyes.

Description: At first glance, this creature looks like a normal Sea Pig, roaming listlessly about the seabed. But upon closer inspection, the bright blue translucent body and charming apparel signal that this little guy is an Altventurer! Perhaps under the influence of Altare having once called them “pigs,” a number of slightly confused slimes morphed into this shape and took to the bottom of the ocean where they gathered in hopes of releasing enough toxins so that anything nearby “learns” to love Altare too!
Fish Image Alt Text Description: A slug-like creature that has several leg-like appendages, along with four upward turned tentacles. White crystals float around one side, and something resembling a dark blue belt wraps around its middle.
